task_description: Clicking this opens the filters menu
article_txt_arr: You can filter the question-answer pairs shown according to criteria such as date range and evaluation status.
The filter icon is actually a button.  You can click the icon to open the filter menu.

task_description: Clicking this closes the filters menu
article_txt_arr: You can close the filter menu by clicking the close filter X.

task_description: Setting this to a date causes question-answer pairs before this date to be filtered out of the view
article_txt_arr: You can filter the question-answer pairs shown by date.
For example, you can filter out any question-answer pairs before a given date by setting the first date filter input.
In other words, you can show only question-answer pairs starting on or after a given date by setting the first date filter input.

task_description: Setting this to a date causes question-answer pairs after this date to be filtered out of the view
article_txt_arr: You can filter the question-answer pairs shown by date.
For example, you can filter out any question-answer pairs after a given date by setting the final date filter input.
In other words, you can show only question-answer pairs starting before or on a given date by setting the final date filter input.

task_description: Selecting this checkbox causes question-answer (QA) pairs that have been evaluated to be shown.
article_txt_arr: When reviewing RAG application performance, it can be useful to view only question-answer (QA) pairs that have been evaluated.
You can check the evaluated YES filter checkbox to show QA pairs that have been evaluated.

task_description: Selecting this checkbox causes question-answer (QA) pairs that have not been evaluated to be shown.
article_txt_arr: When evaluating RAG application results, it can be useful to view only question-answer (QA) pairs that have not yet been evaluated.
You can check the evaluated NO filter checkbox to show QA pairs that have not been evaluated yet.

task_description: Specifying a number here causes that many question-answer pairs to be sub-sampled from all QA pairs.  This is useful when there is an overwhelming number of QA pairs and you just want to see a sample of them.
article_txt_arr: Sometimes, there can be so many question-answer (QA) pairs it is overwhelming to try to review them all.
When you specify a number in the random sample input in the filters menu, that many QA pairs will be subsampled from all the QA pairs.

task_description: Clicking this button causes the page to reload
article_txt_arr: You can reload the page with the selected filters by clicking the reload page button.
